However, I was too tired to watch John Carter and fell asleep with approximately 20 minutes left to the movie. Since I missed the ending, now I can go with the extended story line than winds me up in a good book.<|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|>

While credited as a Tom and Jerry cartoon, this is not the cat-and-mouse team but an earlier Mutt-and-Jeff rip-off featuring them going about to survive in today's turbulent world. In the episode, Jerry MEets Jerry and falls in Love with a mouse named Jasper, little does Jerry know that Jasper wants to murder him. Actually what follows is very wild and unexpected turns of events. (There should be a "Mature" tag on this.)

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie is pale by comparison to My Life Is Fairytale.
My Life Is Fairytale is full of unexpected and strangely funny moments that cover this classic with irony and new life. In many occasions we start loving certain characters, that make us love the story even more. My favorite is Xavier, always making

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy sharecropping owners (Rockefellors) with enough money to emigrate to Mars, live in luxury, brilliant architecture (Spann Toledo Paris NY NOLA Coral Gables) without having to work hard for their. They leave a few rowdy, ungrateful survivors to die

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is the first of three starring the same character played by the same actor. Well, it is an enjoyable one and if you like lots of action and a story with few twists it is probably one for you. If you wish to skip several cuts of the love story you can do that
